Name: cat (Chloramphenicol Acetyltransferace)


Description:
cat is a CDS which encodes an enzyme that transfers an acetyl group from acetyl-CoA to chloramphenicol, eliminating chloramphenicolâ€™s binding to the bacterial ribosomal subunit 50 S. Sufficient expression allows for translation in the presence of otherwise inhibiting levels of chloramphenicol.


Use:
This gene provides bacterial resistance to chloramphenicol. This construct is widely used for the selection of transformants.
